intro: Strobilanthes alboviridis, commonly known as the white-veined strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking white veins on its leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in spikes, which bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
